76e175393767754387c962926577f1660dd9b810187b9002407656be72","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://7d533a1c97cd43a57cd9c465f7ee8dd0e39ae93a8fb8ff8e5303a356b081cdcc","dweb:/ipfs/QmVBEei6aTnvYNZp2CHYVNKyZS4q1KkjANfY39WVXZXVoT"]}},"version":1}

params.newSigner: The address of the new signer wallet

params.round: The round in which you want to claim
params.tokens: The addresses of the token to be claimed

params.round: The round number of which access is changed
params.status: The access status of the round

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

params.minAmountsToken: The minimum amounts of tokens recipient will get
params.round: The round in which user will purchase
params.tokenPrices: The current prices of the tokens in 10 decimals

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.claims: The tokens and amount to claim

params.newPresale: The address of the new PreSale contract

ADMIN_ROLE().notice: Returns the identifier of the ADMIN_ROLE role

COMMISSIONS_MANAGER().notice: Returns the identifier of the COMMISSIONS_MANAGER role

approveAllowance(address[]).notice: Gives max allowance of tokens to presale contract

claim(uint32,address[]).notice: Claims the amount in a given round

enableClaims(uint32,bool).notice: Changes the claim access of the contract

isEnabled(uint32).notice: Stores the enabled/disabled status of a round

pendingClaims(address,uint32,address).notice: Stores the amount of token in a round of the user

presale().notice: Returns the address of presale contract

purchaseWithClaim(uint32,uint256,uint8[].notice: Purchases presale token with claim amounts

setClaim(address[],uint32,(address,uint2.notice: Updates token amounts to addresses in a given round
